values:
Just wanted to send some a shout out to pukajen 

hope today was wonderful, and that you didn't work too hard!

 

 

Sending warm wishes....and birthday cake!

So first of all let me start by saying.....I'm alive! I know it has been years since I posted, but I just wanted to let everyone know how wonderful my birthday was.
  My day started out like normal. John and Madi always leave before I get up in the morning. They leave early because Madi's baby sitter lives quite some way from our home now. John usually walks in kisses me good bye, and he is on his merry way. Granted, most of the time, I don't even remember him coming in to say good bye. This morning I was vaguely awake when he came in and kissed me, and said, " Happy Birthday baby." So in my mind, I'm thinking I have XX amount of time to sleep before the alarm goes off. Next thing I know, I felt two little hands on my face, with a voice that went along with it. " Happy Birthday, Kim" with a kiss on the cheek. It was all I could do not to smile miles wide. 
  When I got to work, I was showered with kindness. I got flowers, candy, lotion, and the gift of Starbucks from 2 of my coworkers. These came with 2 of the sweetest cards I have ever received.  (One made me cry). I got a plaque that said friends like you are special. Then 2 different coworkers bought me the 1st Harry Potter book, with a bookmark that stated friends are a special gift. THEY ALSO TOOK ME TO LUNCH! I have been in training at work, it seems that we are once again changing how things work at my job. Our company puts out a daily news letter with employees birthday listed. So I got numerous special emails today!  My mom called me this morning and sang Happy Birthday to me, this is not the norm for me. I got home, and my mom called back to ask what I got at work, and I told her flowers, she thought I meant the ones SHE had sent!  Since I was in training, I didn't get my voice message off my phone at work, which more than likely was the front desk calling to say, "You have a delivey!" Let's hope that's what my VM says! ;)
 And at this moment I sit here stuff, because John and Madi took my to ShoGuns. It was my first time to go to a Japanese Steak House....WHAT FUN!...they have officially kicked me out of the kitchen, while they make me a birthday cake!. John, my sweet husband, bought me the sweetest card too!  And I got well wishes via the phone from friends and family. This is what I would consider a perfect day, no DOUBT!

Today is a very special day indeed. A few years back...let me see 20-21? 
A beautiful woman named Crystal was brought into this world. And who could have known when she was born, the greatness she would achieve? Let me start by saying, if you know Crystal and/or myself, you might have heard that we met in high school. "She had a blonde haired sister named Amanda...I had a blonde haired sister named Amanda.  It was a conversation I never knew would bring us to such greatness.  Being older, and definitely wiser  ;) You know the kind of friends you make in high school, the ones that want to go hang out with you at the mall, or go cruising the streets to look for hunky guys. 
Looking back, I see the ones who used me, pretended to be my friends, the superficial ones that wanted me to be there buddy to go places with them......then there was Crystal. There is not a time in the many years that I can remember a time that Crystal hasn't been there. The heartaches...too many to count.....the joys, the laughter, and the tears. And if you don't know Crystal, then you are unfortunate. Crystal is the girl everyone wants to have as their friend. She so much fun, he laugh can light up a room, she will give you hug just at the right time. She is a wonderful friend to have. 
She inspires me. I love that Crystal is not afraid to be Crystal. She has a huge heart, and would help just about anyone. I know that she has always been there, and I know she always will be. If you know her, I'm sure you love her. And blessed are each of us who get to call her "friend". 
I love you and wish you all the best! And we get to add another year on the long time line that we get to call friendship.
HAPPY BIRTHDAY CRYSTAL!

Just wanted to wish everyone a Happy Easter!
Don't forget to save me some chocolate!

OMG.....where to start.
Do you ever think, will I ever get things in my life right? I feel so disconnected from everything right now. And when I say everything, I mean EVERYTHING. Today, as I got up and started off to work, I literally felt like the walking dead. A Zombie? A Robot? Just going through the motions. Ya know? When I think about "the girls"...it feels like YEARS since I have been in touch with them (which is an exaggeration-NO DOUBT). I don't really know where this is coming from. I just feel like I am never going to have time even to do the simple stuff. I know that buying a house is SO time consuming, but my wonderful husband is doing the majority of the "HARD STUFF" with all of it.  And you know that "good part" that's in each of us. Mine came back and bit me in the ass! When I was married before, and was getting a divorce, my ex husband took my credit cards and ran up huge bills on them. Then the nice judge decided that since my ex husband decided to file bankruptcy, and both of our names were on these cards....I would get to pay his bills as well as my own. In the whole house buying process I am trying to locate some of these papers of the things that I payed off. Wanna talk about PAIN IN THE BUTT!!! Luckily I have a lawyer in the fam who is helping me! Some part of me wonders if it has something to do with my granny not being around.  I wonder if I shouldn't be a bit further in the grieving process. Who knows? Who's to say where I should be? We all grieve differently.  I guess I miss my girls, I miss my family (what we use to be), I miss my old job, and my friends there. I need a vacation....somewhere far away....well, somewhere different.
I know it's been forever since I've posted anything....then I come on here gripin' about life! I guess I just needed a bit of a rant.

I really think the icon says it all.  Back in the day, when there was a book store by the name of "BAD BOOK STORE NO COOKIE"....many of my dearest friends came about from this store.  I can remember


writteninstars

asking me to head with her and some friends to the local pub for dollar pizza and pints on Thursday night....along with some Survivor on the telly.  I also am not quite sure, but I think this is the first time I met


reckleslinguist

. (It's true...I'm getting OLD...and my mind can be MUSH!)   Anyway,this is the first time I can remember meeting the sweet Miss J! Not a lot stands out about that night, except the first impression sweet Jackie made. I can remember thinking,  "she is very funny" and "she seems really smart".
And boy-O-boy....was it true....but at the time little did I know that she would also be.....sweet, kind, compasionate, considerate, brainy(no doubt), sexy, DIRTY, naughty, eloquent, giving, loyal,  ....the list could go on and on. Bottom line at the time, I had no idea that Survivor, pizza and pints started one of the greatest friendships a girl can have. Color me blessed, you should all be so lucky to have a Jackie in your world.  Our love for teevee, movies, music, wanna be boyfriends have always been great fun. No one can make you laugh out loud quite like Jackie (except one of my other four delicious best friends....that's you too sweet Mary!) These things are the obvious when it comes to Jack Black...but mainly in a time of need, no matter what the circumstances, you have ALWAYS been so good to me. These are the times when you need a friend/friends. I love you sweet potato. HAPPY BIRTHDAY....see ya soon, and there will be presents involved!   

!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! HAPPY BIRTHDAY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Just wanted to wish birthday cake, songs and Bamber to one special lady today.
Or hey, maybe even smearing cake on Bamber while singing a song! 
Hey a girl can dream!!!!!!!! (and add a little Helo to the mix) ;) OOOO, wait that's my dream! ;)
Happy Birthday to one Ms.

asta77



Hope it was a very good day!

Jobs.....can't live with 'em....well...REALLY...Can't live with out them!!!!!!!!!

I have been back and forth with my new job...new to me. I've been here since July. I really am trying to give it a fighting fair shot. I'm not one to "quit" a job, whether I like it or not. SAD, BUT TRUE.  There have been moments that I have LOVED this job....and I go to days where I HATE this job. We are  a new company, trying to work out some of the bugs. I keep thinking the more I know, the better the job will be. I put in an application about 2-3 weeks ago, and I went in for an interview. Once, I did this I was like "I really don't hate my new job".  I have been so back and forth with all this. It leaves a girls head in a fog. I REALLY want to like my job.....REALLY...it's a really good company to work for. So I got a call back from the guy I interviewed with, I had decided already I didn't want to take the job....it just wasn't what I thought it would be, and the money was not right. He called to tell me he hired someone else, which was cool with me.  I guess really there is no point to my story....just putting it to paper.....I know I will "hang in there", unless something better is thrown in my face. If they wouldn't keep changing my job all the time....this would help too! 

Ok, changing the subject....
My husband is too funny. Being that he works in the brick biz, if a building is going up....he often comments,"wonder what that is going to be?"  Well right down the road, a small building is going up....he asked his infamous question...to which I reply---"it's gonna be a Starbucks".  Anyone who knows me, knows I don't get enough Starbuck's and though Memphis has it's fair share....none are right on the way to work. So I have been kiddin' him that it's gonna be Starbucks. Well this morning when John leaves for work I get this call,
J- Hey, how much do you love me?
K-I love you
J-but how MUCH do you love me?
K- Bunches....why
J- I know what they are building on our street.
K- What is it???
J- STARBUCKS!!!!!!!!
 OOOO Yeah....right on the way to work.......woo hoo....really I was just kidding. Let me start wishing for some more good things, and see if that  happens too ;)

so tonight we once again got a hard time when trying to return some things we got at TARGET.....
you can ask anyone who knows me, they know how much I LOVE TARGET......
Target has pissed me off to NO end....when it came to returning some of out wedding gifts....if it wasn't on our "GIFTLIST" they wouldn't give us credit.........not even store credit...needless to say CASH BACK!!!!
I know that there are people in this world who abuse returns...I KNOW THIS....but these are things Aunt Flow decided would look nice in out home regardless, of the color theme in our bathroom......we weren't asking for anything than store credit....that's all!!!!!!!   So tonight we went to return a paper towel rack we already had gotten off our giftlist....and a few things that had that lovely target symbol on them that we got for Christmas from some of my family, who don't really know John's likes or dislikes.....like the fact that he doesn't drink coffee, yet he got 3 coffee mugs( you know the nice travel kind).  When I got home tonight, I decided to write Target I was so mad. The girl behind the counter informed us that at Target you can only return 2 items a year....(i'm guessing without a receipt).......thus begins the letter..........


I just really needed to let someone know exactly how much a few returns can make or break a store. I know retail, I have worked retail,and currently work in customer service. My husband and I registered with you all for our wedding registry. I had NOTHING but a hassle when trying to return ANYTHING on our list, or the GIFTS we received that were not on our list. Countless times it was a hassle. Tonight after trying to return some Christmas gifts, and a wedding gift at our local Target, we were told that we could only do two returns. My husband was so mad that he told the girl behind the counter, "Just keep it...we don't want it...that's why we are bringing it back!" After returning things to Bed Bath and Beyond, and getting no arguments, you can imagine that I WILL be recommending their wedding registry to my friends getting married. I know I am only one person, and seem one "disgruntled customer" (well two counting my husband). I have a big mouth and people around me will know that as for me and my husband, we WILL NOT be shopping with Target anymore. One use to be loyal customer, Kim XXXXXXXXX / John XXXXXXXX

I'm a bit late to the punch, but not to late to knock a mother out! WOOT!......

Today is a very special occasion indeed. Today is the day that a sweet one named,

anglophileangel
  was brought to this earth. When I think back to all the years of friendship I have shared with you, it is truely hard to remember a time that you weren't around. I feel so lucky to have a tight group of girls to call my friends. 
To Angel, my "murder UR face lovin'.....Target clearance shopping....skull lovin'.....happy tree friends watchin'....Mr. Bean secret crushin'.........no one can keep up with me shoppin'..... nightmare before Christmas huggin'.......smart....beautiful.....creative......funny.....singin' songs at the top of  your lungs fun havin'.....one leg bird lovin'.....smilin'....delightful friend...I ADORE YOU! 
Hope your day was nice and as delightful as you are......miss you, can't wait to PARTY down for your birfday!


HAPPY BIRTHDAY DARLIN'! HOPE IT ROCKED!!!!!!!!!!!!

Needless to say....My time is ALL screwed up. John and I started our trip home yesterday at 2:45pm.....we arrived in Nashville this morning at 9:00ish. Our first leg of the trip was Hawaii to Chicago...7 hours and some odd minutes, John and I sleep very little----even with my night time trip friend, aka Benadryl. When we got to Chicago, our flight home was about 51 minutes according to our pilot...I wouldn't know I slept the minute the plane took off til we landed. It was a good nap...INDEED!  John and dredged home little by little to make it back to Memphis. It was a long drive home. Once we got here we had a breif nap, so we wouldn't sleep all day---as to not sleep tonight. Yet, we are home...we have lots of stories to tell, lots of highlights of the trip. SO MANY. Here are my highlights of the trip.
#1 Marrying John on the beach---with a beautiful day-sunset-minister-photographer-videographer.
#2 Our convertable Mustang----and our new friend, the attack geiko. John didn't know I could move from the front seat of the car to the back seat of the car so quickly. 
#3 The wonderful food, but my favorite was Momma's Fish House.
#4 Playing in the ocean the one night with John...I felt like a kid again.
#5 The way I felt coming back to the hotel in my wedding dress with John. The congrats EVERYWHERE! And so many people said you look so beautiful. (despite the strugle to get into the dress....since my mom couldn't make it....I called the hotel and asked if someone could help me zip my dress....they sent up two women from housekeeping who were SO NICE). My hairstylist/make up artist told me that the mistake women make coming to the ocean who aren't use to it----they say women can gain up to 5 pounds, just from the salt water/salt in the air...they swell up....just what I needed to hear right before putting on my TIGHT dress.  :) And it all the sudden became my girly time which didn't help either!!!!!!!!! Despite the wonderful food I HAD been partaking of! 

All in all it was beautiful, and so fun......there will be more stories to come from the future MS Coffey :)

ps......I noticed when I got back that the LONG post I made before leaving about my trip to Disney, and my Batchlorette party DID NOT POST...I'll  have to play catch up when I ge some rest.
GOOD NIGHT ALL!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! :) Aloha/Mahalo!!!!!!!!!!!!

It's official September 15th, 2006.....it was today that something wonderful happen....today near downtown Memphis...it happened.....:wait for it:......:  wait for it:.....
JUSTIN TIMBERLAKE DAY!!!!!!!    NO CRAP! ....got the key to the city and everything.

Just a little joke there my sweet Kell Bell....really, it was declared JT Day by the mayor.....
            TRUE TRIVIA.....you and JT have bonded!  
I have to let everyone know, one sweet potato was born today, a few years back by the name of blondeheroine.

She is one fantastic woman and friend! How can I have been so lucky to have known such a talented girl for SO long, LUCKY ME....I count you as one of my blessings. So Kelly this is for you, you seemed to like it last year....here's my new rendition......

My favorite McDonald's breakfast pancake eatin', Disney lovin', villian admirer, puppy lovin' (ODE TO SPANK!), baby cooin', creative genius, film makin', JImmy Fallon chasin', Joaquein wantin', big hole wishing, big HOLE SCREAMIN', Johnny Depp wanna-be filmin', Star Wars geek lovin', pink lovin', Superman's Lois, fun lovin', theme park hoppin', bug dodgin', Pepsi drinkin'----best friend loving great gal & I call her friend!

MAY WE ALL BE BLESSED WITH MANY MORE YEARS OF FUN & FRIENDSHIP.NOT LOOKING TO THE PAST,BUT LOOKING FORWARD TO THE FUTURE.
I lover you, Kell Bell. Hope today was magical---I know next weekend will be!
-Kim :)

I am totally exhausted. I got back into the swing of work again after a wonderful Disney filled week. I will post about it, hopefully this weekend.

But for now I want to send out big HUGGZZZ to blondeheroine and her Mom. They ghave had a tough couple of days. Keeping you in my thoughts and prayers.

Well, it's true......
In my busy life of...moving,  getting a new job,  settling in with John , preparing a wedding/reception....I had to speak, and speak LOUDLY, I SAY! Here is another in the land of wonderfulness that is my life. Our dear friend ,Kelly has bestowed upon her group of pals a "basically free" trip to Disney! I promise one girl should be so lucky. I get to spend more precious time with my girls.....(WE WILL MISS YOU JACK-BLACK!) and have time away from all the rig-mo-ro going on around me. I will miss my sweet man as well. DISNEY....did I mention Disney! 
:sings Memories in the corner of my mind:
Kelly, thank you in advance.....I know fun will be well on it's way!
Crystal and Angel.....can't wait to chalk this up in the BIG memories book.
I just love you girls!
TA, TA....morning will be coming soon....
till next time when I bring many wonderful memories of DISNEY!
YAY!

Feeling long winded ***you have been warned***
First, it has been WAY too long since I posted....so here goes.
It's official...I'm in Memphis. Along with all the things I did over the weekend, cleaning the apartment, and handing over the keys was the LAST thing I did in Jackson today. I have to admit it was kinda bittersweet. Lots of memories from the old place, yet lots of new ones to take place here. I am now at my new job, which deals with Insurance Verification, along with filling prescriptions in the near future. This job is far different from ANYTHING I have ever done as a tech. (But in a good way, I think, should I say I hope). I have kept my IV mixing job in Jackson every third weekend, for the extra money...and some friends there.  **letting go is hard , YO.**
And last but not least last night was way too much fun. I had a get together with my gal pals to celebrate my upcoming birthday....more details about that in next post! 
YES, there will be a next post, and soon.
Mainly, just wanted you all to know that I haven't dropped off the face of the earth.
Also hope each of you are well....I promise to keep up with LJ a little better, since my life is calming down a bit now.

Got a call today for an interview tomorrow!
ON SATURDAY!
Wild, huh?  Everyone wish me luck!
:keeps fingers crossed:

The anti-christ is on it's way.......

Mothers......Fathers.......hide your kids!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I won't say exactly how many years ago today ;).....well ok, 29 years ago 
:wink, wink, nudge, nudge:
One beautiful girl was brought into this world.  In your life you have friends who come and go. I have been lucky to have a constant friendship with a person who is nothing but pure delight in my heart.  Over the years, writteninstars and myself have been though many fandoms, many tv actor boyfriends, many loves of our lives, and many crushes. And whether they worked out or not, (I know that one day I WILL be Mrs. Johnny Reznick). Crystal,  you have been there to listen to my nonsense, and the real stuff.  You've helped me through life decisons, the good, and the bad, and THE UGLY!  Just giving a word of advice, and a little love when the bad decisons went wrong.  We've went from young girls, to mature women, and I know when were old and gray, I will have you on my list of close friends.  I am extremely lucky to have such wonderful friends in my world, and luckier to have you as a best friend for so long.  And with the life changes that come our way, I look forward to having  ALL those memories to share.   
"HAPPY BIRTHDAY, PETAL!  "
Have a great day,  I look forward to sharing a movie with you tonight, celebrating another birthday with you tomorrow night, and much fun for many years to come!!!!
I LOVE YOU!

ALL I have to say is "Flooglebooty"

(I haven't laughed this hard in ages!)


AND YES.....OMG>>>>>LOST!!!!!!!!
Hate my family, love my cousin's new baby girl. That is all, carry on.

Ok, for those of you who didn't know (like anyone who knows me doesn't know)...I am a HUGE Goo Goo Dolls fan....Big ...HUGE....Tuesday there new album comes out ...YAY! and thus many interviews on the tube, etc....
Now here comes the fun part....Aug. 21st.....they are coming to NASHVILLE!!!!!!! I know that I have begged, dragged, kicked and screamed to get you gals to go with me (except Angel, I think)...and succeeded....will someone please go with me to this show.....PLEASE! :)
:beggs, pllllleeeeaaassseeee:

Ok, so if you watched the Bachelor...you know that Dr. Travis picked our hometown girl Sarah. As most people I know around here, we really rooted for Sarah. She seemed extremely down to earth, sweet and "right" for the sweet Doc. Well, turns out it's over before it got started. I about cried yesterday when I found out. Sarah's mom actually use to work, where I work now. So, a lot of my co-workers know her (Sarah's mom).  It seems that Travis is finishing up exams, and moving to Colorado. From what I hear, Sarah is staying in Tennessee. On the show, he was very clear about the fact he wanted to move there. She pretty much made it clear that she wanted to stay in Tennessee. AND THERE YOU HAVE IT! DANG!

I'm not quite sure anyone cares but (BATCHELOR SPOILERS AHEAD)......<lj-cut>the batchelor chose Sara, from my hometown....well she lives in Nashville now, but she is from here. And not just that, she WAS the better choice!
Not only is he cute he has a brain too!<lj-cut>

On this beautiful day which gave me a touch of spring fever, we celebrate one of the sweetest gals in town....one MS<lj user="reckleslinguist">. Over the years the fondness of one Jack Black has only grown. She is one of the most considerate women I know. I will never forget when I had a broken heart, she brought me bubble bath. That is only one small thing Jackie has done for me over the years. Jackie you are the sweetest girl. Your wit,charm and wonderful sense of humor, with<strike>a touch</strike> well more than a touch of naughtiness never seises to amaze me. Color me lucky to put you on my list of friends, and even luckier to put on the close friends list. My gaggle of girls are amazing. I love you, hope you had a wonderful birthday, and can NOT wait to party down tommorrow.

What a glorious day to make my television debut.....it is one MS<lj user="asta77">'s birthday! YAY! A little bit late to the draw tonight sweetie, but the thought is the same. You might be one of the sweetest gals I have met on vacation. ;)
I never knew that I might meet someone for the first time and like her so. You are adorable ma'am. I mean how could all my friends be wrong when they told me how wonderful you are. (my friends are smart, I'm just sayin'!).....And who else could have gotten me to fall in love with a "SCI-FI" show. I completley remember <lj user="writteninstars"> saying, "Kim, not a sci-fi kinda girl." Little did we know. HA HA! Happy Birthday darlin'...Hope you had a great day, and a wonderful rest of the week. May your birthday wishes come true, to one well deserving girl.

So it has been FOREVER since I posted, and thought it was time to give an update in my life.  Last week, I got a call from a nice lady from the local televison news.  She had heard though a little bird, <lj user="writteninstars"> that I had met my fiancee through Eharmony. She then asked me if I would mind talking with her about the process. I said, "Sure, why not!"  This was last Saturday, I met with her. I never imagined I would be nervous about this. With the camera in my face, I stumbled over my words, and repeated myself a lot! Let's hope with the power of editing they make me appear smarter than I felt. YIKES! It will air this Wednesday night on the 6:00 news. We'll see. The one thing she said that really surprised me was that she had talked to a few people who had met someone through Eharmony, and NO ONE wanted to admit to the fact they had met there mate that way.  Should I be embarrassed I met the best man I know through this site? HMMMM?
In other news, I really LOVED BSG last night.  One thought, I really loved Baltar's character when I watched the show in the beginning...well and still do. You know an actor is doing a great job, when you can love him and HATE him all in the same episode. Thanks to one <lj user="asta77"> for her wonderful recap of last nights show.
Speaking of BSG, I know that I missed your bday <lj user="danceswithwords">, Hope your day was as wonderful as you are.  Happy BELATED Birthday wishes to you.  Thank you for turning me into one of those "Sci-Fi girls!" ;)
What a beautiful snowy day we have, luckily I have to go NOWHERE today!
I am trying to focus on the positive today, being that yesterday I had a bit of bad news. I am looking for a new job, in a different city, since I will be moving when I get married. My "dream job" testing was yesterday. It was a three part test. The hard test as the "HR Lady" told me was first. I passed it first try! The other girl testing with me passed on her second try, so we were HAPPY!  Second part of the test, typing! I missed it by two words! I was so mad at myself. I had a real bad case of the nerves, it really took a hold of me. It has been nine years since I have been job hunting. So I guess that makes sense. Third part of the test was Excel. I might be the only one in the world, but I know NOTHING about Excel. So, I'm giving myself a year (the next time I can apply there) and I will be a quicker typer, and I WILL know Excel. I will apply again! I plan on posting more, to improve my typing skills! I GOT SKILLS! Yeah, I said it! Until next time people, I will sit and enjoy the beautiful snow.

HELP.....
ok, for christmas I got an Ipod......and reading into it, it says you must have Windows 2000, or XP.....anyone know a way around this. BTW, I have Windows 98. (old, yeah I know)
Any help is good help....thanks in advance!

Well, let me start by saying that 2005, might have been the best year ever!
Highlights of my year included a lovely trip to San Fran, in which I got to explore a new part of the world, which I *LOVED*!
I met lots of new LJ friends, that I have gotten to keep up with thanks to LJ. I met a girl who couldn't be any sweeter, I would vacation with you anytime Mary. I met  man, and fell head over feet. No DOUBT. We will be married next year. I still have the greatest group of friends a girl could have. They would be there for me through thick and thin. I kept a friendship that I wasn't sure would keep. My grandmother is still alive. My brother and myself bonded more this year. I will have a beautiful step-daughter this time next year. I will be taking two trips that I know of already in 2006. One big HOO-RAA for the girls(Jackie this means you too). And honeymoonin' in Hawaii. 
I wonder if 2006 will compare to 2005.....so far it looks as though it might!
Happy New Year to you all.......
Enjoy lifes little moments......
:)

Well....It's official, I'm home. I have been home for a few days now, but my mind wouldn't know it. Tonight is the first night I have had to take some time for myself, in a *VERY* long time. First I wanted to say, "Thank You" for all the well wishes on my engagement. It's so odd to think about how this man has changed my life. I didn't even LIKE him when we first started dating. I am a lucky girl, and that's all on the mush factor.
I had a really nice time in KY, I felt as though I have gotten to know John's parents better. It seems to get better each time I'm there. The lack of communication seems to get better a bit more each time. (John's parents are deaf.) I learn a bit more sign each time we go. This week John's daughter came with us;she is four, and adorable. She seems to really like me, which is a plus. John and I spent quite a bit of time with his younger bro, Mark, this time. I'm enjoying getting to know him more. We went to see King Kong (with my baby daddy, Adrien Brody, in it). Personally, I liked the movie alot. It WAS long....but not unbearable. I had a small meltdown Christmas Eve when I was suppose to come home via airplane for Christmas with my family. John and I decided to ride together to KY, and that I would fly home a day early from KY to be with my family. WEEELLLLLLLLL.....I had talked to a Northwest agent and asked her if I missed my plane to KY, would they save my seat on the way back. SHE SAID YES!....they told me NO at the airport. They then proceeded to tell me that I needed to purchase another ticket(one way ticket) to get home. I called the person, told her what was going on...she then tells me I will have to buy another ticket which is $200 MORE to get home. I told her I didn't have the money, and basically I needed a ticket for that day. She then tells me how she can get me on another flight DECEMBER 31ST! "Hello"...I need to be home DEC 24TH...besides the fact I had to work four hours Christmas Day. So I ended up hanging up on the woman, because she was terribly RUDE. I'm freakin' out a bit, John says we'll go home the 24th night. I tell him NO b/c he was playing Santa for his daughter, and having Xmas with the fam the 25th. I called my mom in a panic, and then think that I will try NW one more time. I am completely making an ass of myself, b/c I am crying like a two year old. This lady can tell I'm upset, and asks me what's going on. I tell her best I can without sobbing into the phone, she finally tells me to let it out. That did it....and I did. She told me to go talk to a manager. John and I waited for 45 minutes, and it was getting closer to time for the plane to take off. Finally, my folks told me that they bought me another ticket, and to "JUST GET HOME". I go to the NW counter, and am completley blubbering, and told them....."My parents bought me a new ticket, get me on the plane. The whole reason I came to KY was b/c I had a free voucher, and it was free, and this is why I did this." The guy looks at me and says "Merry Christmas, get on the plane;tell your parents to refund there ticket." I think I said Thank you. Maybe? But I made it....home for the holidays! And it has been a great Christmas, besides that. I got lots of cool stuff(INCLUDING AN IPOD!)....and I haven't even had Christmas with the girls yet! Hope you all had a wonderful holiday.

Well, I spent the weekend in lovely KY. I completley understand why John brags on his state so much. It's a nice place, but I would never tell him that..hee hee ;)
So we went to Ky Friday night after I got off work. We got into Lawerenceburg pretty late. We got up the next morning and had lunch, via the time change, what could have been breakfast....now is known as lunch. We watched some football with John's best buds.....and the wives fixxed dinner for everyone. Then the reason we went to Ky in the first place, was for John and his brothers to get a picture made together for their parents for Christmas. The pics turned out well, from what we understand. There were serious pics...and a couple funny ones. I can't wait to see them! On the way home Sunday, John and I stopped in Elizabethtown to see the sights. When we got home to Jackson, we went to the 7:00 showing of Elizabethtown. The movie was good, I had heard it was getting so-so reviews. I went in expecting nothing, and I liked it. It wasn't a blow-me-away movie, but it was good. There were alot of KY refrences in the movie, including Orlando Bloom drinking an Ale 8. John was beside himself. It was really neat to see the town, then the movie.  Fun was had by all, I did completely miss my girls though. AND I SO WANNA SEE PROOF, is it worth seeing?

If it's a celebration of some sort, just know if you are friends with her...your gift will be special and unique like our friend Kelly. I've said it once and I'll say it again, "Kelly has more talent in her pinky than most people will ever have." Her list of fandoms are large and vast. I know that my list of friends could never be complete without her. So today on your day <lj user="blondeheroine">, however you choose to spend it......I am sending much love your way.  To my favorite Johnny Depp lovin', Perkin's Pie eatin' (scrape the GOO off!), Super Hero/Villian lover, Screamin' in a hole taper, Star Wars--fake Anikon lovin', Elvis week hatin', Republican kickin',  21 Jump Street watchin', Apple Laffy Taffy eatin'......pal of a gal.........

hope you have so many more, that we all continue to celebrate together! MUCH LOVE! :muah!:

I am totally playing catch up on my weekend happenings, aka FRIDAY FROM HELL....
this will more than likely be a long post, you have been forwarned!
First,  work on Friday....as most of you know, I work in a hospital pharmacy. My day started farily normal. Then about 8:00a.m. A co-worker came to the back where we worked, and told me they are clearing the basement where we work, b/c somewhere in the hospital was flooding. We have drills for *everything* ALL the time. I am figuring this is something like that. I take my time getting out of the IV room, to realise that me and one other person are the ONLY two people in the pharmacy. We grabbed our purses (JIC)...and went on our merry way. As we exit the pharmacy we hear security guards telling people, "Don't look back, just move, GO, GO, GO!" I turn around and it's like a movie, around the corner comes a steady flow of water. It was crazy! So we take out running. In my head, I'm like, IS THIS REAL? It felt like something that I would see on TV or a movie. We watch the people scatter to escape this mysterious water. We end up outside in the parking garage. We then "meet" upstairs in the cafeteria. Long story short, we played RX techs in the lunch room. It was hard! We were literally running things upstairs, and down. It was CRAZY! I swear.  I had to take 8-9 flights of stairs at one point, nothing like the stairs and the heat to let you know exactly how OUT OF SHAPE you really are. When I finally made it back to the lunch room, I was exhausted. All day up and down stairs. I hadn't had time for lunch yet, and realised I felt faint. So I sat, wolfed down a sandwich, and some water, and thought all was ok. We finally got things cleaned and drained enough to be back in the RX by 2:00pm...things were hectic, but getting done. We got things caught up and around 5:00pm, I started to feel ill. In my mind, I was thinking.."Kim, you just got to hot today."
Got home and was waiting for John to get to my house, I went to lay down, next thing I knew, I was throwing up.
My head hurt badly. I was thinking give me an hour, I know it will pass. I didn't! Not only did it not pass, it was the most pain I have endured in my lifetime. This was not a simple headache. I was at the point that I was scared. My Mom met me and John at the apartment. We went to the local convient care. The doc then tells me with the severe pain, and vomitting, I can't be sure that it's not a anurisum (SP?). So yes, my blood pressure shot up a bit more. He sent me to the ER for a catscan. I was poked like a pin cushion, and scanned , and probed, and prodded. The final conclusion was that all my test came back ok. I got a major shot of narcotics, that made me stop hurting for the first day, and made me feel like crap the next day. All in all, that was the biggest scare I have had yet in my 32 years of living. I'm good now, and have not had a headache since. Knock on wood. John was a real angel during all this.
And I am off to bed, hoping tomorrow fairs better than my last Friday.

Well, this morning was totally weird.....
first, I woke up late, and got to work late....COMPLETLEY OVERSLEPT!....guess I just didn't hear my alarm. Then had the day straight from you know where....
DANG!......then about 3:00pm....a girl that works in the prescription area walks over and says to me, "Special Delivery". I received the most beautiful Irises. Purple and pretty. What a pick me up! When I think the man can't possibly top himself, he does. They were from John. What a sweet man! After work I had planned on going to see Scottie, which I did. We grabbed dinner, and went and picked up a few groceries, some for him, some for me. Then proceeded back to Memaw's home. He and I had a very detailed talk. Mostly about his role as caregiver to my granny, and where she might be 6 months from now. We talked about how hard it is to watch people you love get old, and that she will more than likely end up in a home. He told me things tonight about his home life, that explains alot about who he is as a person. I am really glad he confided in me. I like where he and I stand, FRIENDS. I am glad that I have a boyfriend who understands me, and can except this, even when I didn't know what to expect (BIG THANKS TO CRYSTAL THIS WEEK, you know why). I just feel lucky. I have great people who surround me, including all of you. Bad days turned good. Night all!

Did you know that West TN. had an earthquake today, YES....it is true. 
I was sitting at my parents home this morning, my step-dad and I were waiting for a few extra minutes to pass. My parents live near Florida Steel, heck, I'm not sure what they do there. From time to time though the house will kinda shake, and we know that it's Florida Steel. So, Bill and myself looked at each other, and I said "What was that?" In which he commented, "It was Florida Steel". We we both like "Wow, ok". Then I stopped back at my parent tonight, and I told Bill it was an earthquake, he said, "I know, they were talking about it on the radio the minute I got into my car". Then we both laughed, "HAHAHA, Florida Steel!" It wasn't a huge one it was a 4.0...but I can say I actually felt it. Now I can understand why all my San Fran friends talk about freakin' if a Earthquake were to hit.
Ok, next subject.....
Did anyone watch "Hit Me Baby One More Time"? Kim=guilty...I did it!
I love the idea, but I thought there was gonna be more to it! All these "has beens" get together to perform the "Hit" song, then they do a cover tune by other famous bands. The winner got a donation to their fav charity. I guess it was nice and all, but I wanted more. So sue me!

There's this pearl of a girl that I know. She's pretty close to perfect in every way. We've been friends forever now(yes, it's official!). As the years pass us by, I tend to treasure friends more and more. Yours is a friendship many people can only hope comes around once in a lifetime. Luckily, our friendship has lasted half of our lives. Who knew when we chatted about our sisters so many years ago, that this would come to be. My memories of you and me are endless. I have to admit, I cherish everyone! (even the bad). I love you, you beautiful fangirl. Your fandom is vast, as prolly' as long as our friendship;) I'm glad I have been there close to every step of the way. I think about the things that you have provided me to make life richer, and fuller. It's amazing. Thank you for being the best friend a girl could ask for. I love you deeply, and hope that this year brings you as much happiness as you've brought me......vacations, birthdays,holidays,boyfriends,friends....our list is long....and thank God for that. I love you petal....O YEAH.....(lol)

So as many of you know I hit Memphis in May Sunday for round 2 of concert goodness. Ever since I found out Billy Idol was coming on Sunday, I KNEW I had to be there. So first off,we saw some older gentleman singing, I never got his name. Obviously, I wasn't impressed. Sorry little guy. 1-10? 1....ouch I know.
Then was Lisa Marie Presley, the girl who went with me really likes LMP or LMFP(I'll let you guess about that one)that is what her hat/shirts say. Can't say I hated her. I thought she was actually really good. For who she is and what she does, she makes NO excuses about it. I think that is one of the things that makes her appealing. I can say she is a beautiful woman. She has a strong fanbase. I can say Memphis seemed to love her. Me? I'd give her a 7 of 10, not bad.
After LMP was War. I have seen these guys before. They are SO MUCH FUN! Unfortunately, they were having technical difficulties. They couldn't get the keyboard sounds to work. It seemed as though as so on as they got on-stage, they were getting offstage. War is always a good show. 9 of 10. (And I say 9 b/c they didn't get to play the entire set).
Next, the one the only Billy Idol! Ok, so for most people the thought of seeing Billy Idol might be"BIG DEAL". I have to admit, I WAS one of those people. You know you see these people when your growing up on MTV(yes back when they did play videos) over, and over, and over. There was something about seeing this man I grew up listening to up close and personal. I had two immediate observations, first BI is in excellent shape to be his age, secondly Mr. Idol is one perverse/horny man. He was high energy the entire show, making crude hand gestures from time to time. Singing to one beautiful girl to the next. He really likes the ladies. He was so personable. The crowd went wild on many occasions when he sang old favorites "Flesh for Fantasy", "Rebel Yell", "Hot in the City", "Eyes Without a Face". Honest to God, one of the BEST concerts I have ever seen! 10 of 10! As he stated at the end of his show,"I'm Billy F***** Idol!" Yes, Yes he is!
Last but not least, The Black Crows. I mean after BI, not much can compare. I like the BCs but when did they become a "Jam Band". *So* not my thing. But it was nice seeing Kate Hudson dancing along the side of the stage as her husband sang. Earlier in the day, we saw them walk out of the tent with their baby. Really sweet family. BC's 7 of 10. It was a great time, glad I got to see all the people I did get to see. It was alot of fun!

Well last night, a gal I work with and myself decide to go to Memphis in May....this was her first time for her to go. I asked her if she minded standing in the rain to watch the shows? She told me no.....so with rain in the forecast, we decided to go. I did have fun, but it was wet and miserable! We decided to stay at one stage, because my friend really wanted to see the Wallflowers.
The first guy was Michael Tolcher( never heard of him). He was really good. Cute little guy with spunk.
I would rate him 8 on a 1-10 scale. Next was Ingram Hill, memphis favs, I have seen them before, and loved them everytime. This time was no exception. About two songs into their set, the sound/power went out. The crowd was sad, but the lead singer tried to entertain the crowd on his own. Barely hearing what he was saying, he starts to sing their newest hit "Almost Perfect". The crowd is eating this up, singing all the words along with him, as he smiles as big as the sun. He was loving it too. So 15-20 minutes later, the sound is back! He says he wants the crowd to feel like they got there moneys worth, so he sang it again. He also mentioned that in his professional career, that had to be the highlight. He is really awesome. 1-10?....I'd say a 10. Later was Gavin Degraaw, whom I love. He put on a great show as well. 9 out of 10. Mavis Staples came out next, and belted the crowd away! She rocked! A solid 9 I must say. And last but not least, we saw the Wallflowers. I must say, Jacob Dillion is strikingly handsome. As good of a band as they are, they don't really "entertain" the crowd, Jacob is a bit laid back. They were still very good. I'd say an 8.
Rain and all, fun was had by myself, and Heather.
